snippet: The former comptroller of Dixon pleaded not guilty on Monday to charges that she stole more than $53 million of the public’s money to finance a lavish lifestyle and create one of the nation’s foremost horse-breeding operations.
abstract: Rita Crundwell, the former comptroller of Dixon, Ill, pleads not guilty to charges that she stole more than $53 million of the public’s money to finance a lavish lifestyle and create one of the nation’s foremost horse-breeding operations.
lead_paragraph: The former comptroller of Dixon pleaded not guilty on Monday to charges that she stole more than $53 million of the public’s money to finance a lavish lifestyle and create one of the nation’s foremost horse-breeding operations.

headline.main: Illinois: Not-Guilty Plea in $53 Million Theft
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Not-Guilty Plea In $53 Million Theft
